newsitem.title: ROMANIA: RADIO ROMANIA AFTERNOON HEADLINES AT 4 PM.
newsitem.headline: RADIO ROMANIA AFTERNOON HEADLINES AT 4 PM.

text.p: * Opposition Democratic Convention leader Emil Constantinescu has registered his candidacy in November 3 presidential polls with the Central Electoral Bureau. His candidacy was supported by some 250,000 signatures.
* "I run for president because I Romanians deserve a better life and I am sure it's possible and I would be able to offer them a better life," Constantinescu told journalists.
* National Liberal Alliance launched literary critic Nicolae Manolescu as its candidate for presidency.
* Upper Senate discussed bill to control dignitaries fortune.
* Government held conference with local government officials to prepare for November 3 polls.
Some 7.5 million voters' cards are ready at local mayors' offices and some two million cards have been mailed so far.
* Agriculture Minister Alexandru Lapusan presented full report on current situation in autumn farming campaign.
* State's involvement in the economy is the only way to guarantee decent living standards for Romanians, Socialist Labour party leaders said.
* Some 40 new cases of viral meningitis were registered in the past three days with 380 people hospitalised across the country, of which 20 died, a health ministry statement said.
* Recent floods damaged 100 households in villages from the northern Suceava county. -- Bucharest Newsroom 40-1 3120264
